name: Hide User Profile Fields
author: Gustavo Brandao Guerra

sections.description:
A simple plugin with no-backend interface, to clean up some dummy fields from user profiles edition and creation pages, focused on corporate purposes. The following fields are removed right after this plugin activation: Colors Profile, Keyboard Shortcuts, Toolbar, AIM, Jabber, Yahoo IM, Website URL, Biography Description and User Role (every new user is created as Subscriber)
Some contents was inspired on teachingyou.net
sections.installation:
1. Upload hide-user-fields.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Navigate to the ‘Hide User Profile Fields’ Settings menu and enable it.
sections.faq:
How do I enable this plugin?

Once the plugin itself is installed, navigate to the ‘Hide User-Profile Fields’ Settings menu, check the lone checkbox, and click ‘Update Options’.

How can I hide/unhide some specific fields?

You can’t, not through this plugin, but you can edit this as your needs.
sections.changelog:
1.2

  • Color Profiles and other checkboxes will also be hidden on this version.

1.0.0

  • First published version.
